title: U.S. Attacked Boat With Aircraft That Looked Like a Civilian Plane
summary: Even accepting the Trump administration’s claim that there is an armed conflict with suspected drug runners, the laws of war bar “perfidy.”

title: Russian Missiles Failed in Venezuela During U.S. Attack
summary: The Venezuelan regime had high-powered air defense systems from its allies in the Kremlin, but failed to set much of it up.

title: In Venezuela, Amnesty for Political Prisoners Stokes Hope and Frustration
summary: Venezuela’s new leaders and President Trump have alluded to a major release of political prisoners, but the liberations have been slow to come.

title: Lawyer Whom Maduro Didn’t Hire Is Booted From His Case
summary: Last week, a lawyer came forward claiming to represent the unseated president of Venezuela, Nicolás Maduro. The judge overseeing the case settled the matter on Monday.

title: FBI’s ICE Shooting Inquiry Examines Renee Good’s Possible Ties to Activist Groups
summary: Former department officials warned that such a broad inquiry raised the specter that forms of political protests could be criminalized.

title: Trump Officials Are Sending 1,000 More Immigration Officers to Minnesota
summary: The Customs and Border Protection officers are joining 2,000 other officers and agents at the Department of Homeland Security who have recently been deployed to the Minneapolis region.

title: Minnesota and Illinois Sue Trump Administration Over ICE Deployments
summary: The two Democratic-led states claimed in separate lawsuits that the immigration enforcement campaigns violated the Constitution.

title: DOJ Charges Luis Nino-Moncada, Who Was Shot by Border Patrol in Portland
summary: Last week’s shooting of two Venezuelan immigrants put the city on edge. Federal officials said the man who was shot had repeatedly backed into a Border Patrol car.

title: Fed Changes Course and Takes On Trump’s Political Fight
summary: The Justice Department’s decision to open up a criminal investigation of Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve, is a major escalation in the pressure campaign against the central bank to cut interest rates.

title: What to Know About the Criminal Investigation of Fed Chair Jerome Powell
summary: The Justice Department’s probe into whether Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve, lied about renovations to the central bank’s headquarters has raised alarms.

title: Top Fed Official Conveys Little Urgency for Immediate Rate Cuts
summary: The Federal Reserve is likely to hold interest rates steady when it meets at the end of the month, keeping tensions high with President Trump.

title: Kelly Sues Pentagon Over Threats of Punishment From Hegseth
summary: Senator Mark Kelly, Democrat of Arizona, asked a federal judge to block the Trump administration from disciplining him for a video warning about illegal military orders.

title: Federal Prosecutor Is Fired Amid Further Turmoil in Comey Case
summary: Robert K. McBride had been serving as the top deputy to Lindsey Halligan, who has continued to act as the U.S. attorney for the Eastern District of Virginia.

title: Judge Blocks Trump Effort to Stop Rhode Island’s Revolution Wind Project
summary: The ruling means that construction can continue on Revolution Wind, a $6.2 billion project off the coast of Rhode Island, at least for now.

title: E.P.A. to Stop Considering Lives Saved by Limiting Air Pollution
summary: In a reversal, the agency plans to calculate only the cost to industry when setting pollution limits, and not the monetary value of saving human lives, documents show.

title: Meta Plans to Cut 10% to 15% of Employees in Reality Labs Business
summary: The layoffs are set to be announced this week and would affect Meta’s work on the metaverse, as the company spends heavily on building artificial intelligence.

title: Apple Teams Up With Google for A.I. in Its Products
summary: Apple was facing increasing questions about its plans for artificial intelligence as other big tech companies invested tens of billions in the technology.

title: Trump Explores Diplomacy With Iran While Weighing Strikes, Officials Say
summary: Abbas Araghchi, the foreign minister of Iran, said his government was ready to negotiate with the United States. Iranian security forces are cracking down on protests.

title: Iran Says It Is Prepared for War but Ready to Negotiate After Trump’s Warnings
summary: The comments came after President Trump said he was “ looking at some very strong options” to curb the Iranian authorities’ harsh repression of anti-government protests.

title: Duke Webb, a Green Beret, Went on a Shooting Rampage. Is the Army at Fault?
summary: High-tempo Special Operations training can cause brain injuries that accumulate unnoticed. One soldier says that is why he snapped and killed three people.

title: Inside Democrats’ Brewing Debate Over Which States Should Vote First in 2028
summary: Does Iowa deserve another shot? Is South Carolina too red? New Hampshire too white? Nevada too far-flung? Democrats are starting their calendar from scratch, and there’s a lot to consider.

title: With Democrats at a Crossroads, Elizabeth Warren Urges a Left Turn
summary: The Massachusetts senator signaled alarm about her party’s movement toward the center, warning in a speech that Democrats should not cozy up to the wealthy and the powerful.

title: Arson Suspect Targeted Mississippi Synagogue for Its ‘Jewish Ties,’ F.B.I. Says
summary: The suspect, Stephen Spencer Pittman, was turned in by his father, who said his son had laughed as he confessed to the fire that damaged the synagogue, investigators said.

title: The Weimar Republic Shaped the 20th Century. Can Today’s Leaders Avoid Its Fate?
summary: A fragile democracy, the Weimar Republic, briefly took hold in Germany before the Nazis seized power. Now, Weimar’s collapse is seen as a warning.

title: In This Town, the Groundhog May Never See Its Shadow Again
summary: Since Milltown Mel died, a New Jersey town has faced a groundhog crisis. Now the governor has vetoed an effort to bring in out-of-state replacements.

title: Trump’s Attack on the Federal Reserve Is Already Backfiring
summary: And the market is gently shrugging.

title: This Rural Congresswoman Thinks Democrats Have Lost Their Minds. She Has a Point.
summary: Marie Gluesenkamp Perez thinks too many members of her party miss what’s really driving the alienation and anger in our society.

title: Notable Republicans Criticize Investigation of Fed Chair
summary: Also, Iran said it is ready for war, but open to negotiate. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

title: World Court Hears Groundbreaking Genocide Case Against Myanmar
summary: The case was brought to the World Court by a country not directly affected by the alleged genocide of the Rohingya, a precedent for similar claims against other countries, including Israel.

title: Leaders of Historians’ Group Veto Resolutions Critical of Israel
summary: The executive council of the American Historical Association said the resolutions, including one accusing Israel of ‘scholasticide’ in Gaza, would put the group at risk.

title: Nearly 15,000 Nurses Go on Strike at Major New York City Hospitals
summary: Workers are demanding more robust staffing levels and higher pay. The strike comes three years after a smaller job action won significant gains.

title: Former Congressional Employee Accused of Stealing 240 Phones
summary: A Maryland man used his government job to order new cellphones worth over $150,000 and then sell them to a pawnshop, federal prosecutors said.
